newsitem.title: UK: Tunisia, Egypt straight-run tenders due Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: Tunisia, Egypt straight-run tenders due Wednesday.

text.p: The results of Tunisian and Egyptian tenders to sell low sulphur straight run fuel oil should be announced on Wednesday, traders said on Tuesday.
Tunisia has offered one 35,000 tonne spot cargo, loading April 22-24, traders said. They added that it followed the usual pattern of an exchange of high sulphur cracked fuel plus a premium.
A second Tunisian exchange tender, for around 30,000 tonnes for each month from May to December, will be decided at the same time.
Traders said it was the reissue of a term contract first announced in February but cancelled because prices bid were poor.
The last Tunisian spot tender, for a cargo to load April 6-8, was awarded on Friday and was heard won by a Swiss-based independent trader.
The Egyptian General Petroleum Corp (EGPC) tender to sell 25,000 tonnes of low sulphur straight run closed on Tuesday. The tender is for an Alexandria cargo loading April 22-24.
